# SNIPS: INSTALLATION AND WORKING

## INSTALLATION AND TUTORIALS SNIPS (.AI)

Installation tutorial for Snips (.ai) on a raspberry pi 3. Note: at point of making this Snips (.ai) only works on Raspbian Sketch and older raspbian versions but this is not tested. It at this point does not work yet on Raspbian Buster. In the futere this may be possible.
The link below is a tutorial how to install Snips (.ai) on a Raspberry Pi and a quick how to get started.
- [Installation and quick start Snips on Raspberry Pi](https://docs.snips.ai/getting-started/quick-start-raspberry-pi)
Making a assistant on the Snips website is not that complicated, but takes some getting use to. The link below is also a quick getting started and in the video that go trow the process of making a Snips assistant.
It would be a lot of explaining for something that is very easy to use.
- [How to make a Snips assistant](https://www.hackster.io/matrix-labs/voice-control-your-lights-with-snips-ai-and-a-matrix-device-9c54ce)

When Snips is installed on the Raspberry Pi the following commands have to be used

- Sam connect <ip-adress>:
The <ip-adress> has to be the ip-adress of the network you want to connect to.

- Sam status:
This command is used to check the different status of the Snips assistant.

- Sam watch:
This command activates the Snips assistant.

## OPERATION OF SNIPS

In this section the different steps for the communication between Snips (.ai) and the PLC will be discussed.
Snips (.ai) is, as mentioned before, a speech-to-text program. Which makes uses of mqtt for communication with other programs or devices. This communication protocol is also used for communication between Snips (.ai), on the Raspberry Pi, and the PLC.
The operation/communication between Snips (.ai) and the PLC will be discussed step by step in the following point.
- When starting the Raspberry Pi, the Snips (.ai) assistant, including the broker, also starts up.
- To give a command, the "wake word" must first be said. In this project it has been kept default to "Hey Snips".
- After the "wake word" is spoken, a sentence can be spoken that contains the different commands. Some of these commands are:
  - Scan
  - Show object
  - â€¦
  
In order to keep the different applications saperated with the commands they can recieve 3 different applications have been made in the Snips (.ai) assistant. 
One for the Vision section, one for the Cartesian robot and one for the Text-to-speech section.
This can also be seen in the image below.

![](data:image/*;base64,)

The different commands for vision and the PLC (Cartesian robot) are mentioned in the respective sections.
- When one or more commands is detected, the Snips (.ai) program will send a json string to the broker, with the different commands in it. This json string will then be received by the PLC.
- The PLC has a program running that listens to the broker for possible json strings that can be sent.
- When the PLC (program) receives a json message, it will analyse it for the different commands it contains. The different commands are then used to preform different task with the cartesian robot.

It must be mentioned before hand that it is not possible to mix intents of different applications. This is how Snips operates. It is not possible to say a sentence with a intent of Vision and the Cartesian robot. In this case only one of the commands will be sent over the broker.

## POSSIBLE PROBLEMS

There have also been some problems showing up while using MQTT on the PLC (cartesian robot). The mayor problem that has occurred, is that the MQTT code (/program) that handles the communication between the PLC and broker, only works on the latest version of the system. In older versions, of the operating system of the PLC, the libraries about MQTT are not integrated. The system while therefore not go into the "run mode", making it impossible to run code.
